webdev.title: There are different parts of a website, which would you like to be involved in

options.title: Design the structure of websites
options.more_info: Design and structure the beautiful (visible) layouts of the website. For building cool User Interfaces. It is called Front-end web development

options.title: Build servers, and communicate with database
options.more_info: For building the unseen parts of a website or web app (server-side) i.e the server. It involves logic, analysing and handling data, technical construction of websites. It is called Back-end web development

options.title: Be involved in both
options.more_info: Involved in both front-end and back-end web development. It is called full-stack web development

So here are framework/library you should look out for

options.title: ReactJS
options.more_info: React is a popular JavaScript library that is used to build user interfaces and single-page applications

options.title: Tailwind CSS
options.more_info: TailwindCSS is a utility-first CSS framework used for easily styling your web pages

options.title: VueJS
options.more_info: Vue is a progressive framework for building user interfaces. It is mostly used by developers in place of ReactJS

options.title: Three.js
options.more_info: Three.js is a cross-browser JavaScript library and application programming interface used to create and display animated 3D computer graphics in a web browser using WebGL.

server-languages.title:
You only need one server language to be a back-end developer.
Here are some of the best options in the industry today

options.title: NodeJS
options.more_info: NodeJS is a JavaScript run-time environment for building servers. If you already know JavaScript, I recommend going for this option

options.title: Python
options.more_info: Python is a programming language. With tools like Flask, Django, you can build a server in Python easily

options.title: PHP
options.more_info: PHP is a server-side scripting language made for building servers.

options.title: Ruby
options.more_info: Ruby is a general-purpose, interpreted programming language that supports various programming paradigms such as procedural, functional, and object-oriented programming

options.title: Rust
options.more_info: Rust is a multi-paradigm scripting language that guarantees memory safety by validating references. It is syntatically similar to C++

options.title: Java
options.more_info: The primary advantage of using Java is that it works on the Write Once Run Anywhere principle. So if you already know Java, it can be useful here too

database.title: Here are the options of database

options.title: MongoDB
options.more_info: MongoDB is a NoSQL database management system that works well with popular server languages like JavaScript and Python

options.title: MySQL
options.more_info: MySQL is relational database management system. It uses SQL

options.title: NativeJSONDB
options.more_info: NativeJSONDB is a NOSQL database that stores data in JSON format. It is a good choice for storing data in a serverless environment. Still in development

how-to-learn.title: This is how I used the React resources to learn React, with an article explaining everything

options.title: Code along a tutorial
options.more_info: Step 1 is to code along with a tutorial/crash course that will introduced you to React by creating a React project

options.title: Study the docs
options.more_info: Step 2 is to study the react docs, try out as many examples on the documentation. If you don't fully grasp the docs, try out step 3

options.title: Take a React course (optional)
options.more_info: This step solidifies your understanding of React, I recommend taking this step if the react docs is not clear enough

options.title: Create more projects
options.more_info: Now is the time to create more projects. Try creating 4 to 5 different React projects

options.title: Bonus: Learn in public
options.more_info: Learning in public is like marketing yourself to a dev community. As such you may find companies interested in hiring you
